translation:

"how can we even talk about data privacy when our personal information is collected and sold by corporations and governments every day? ü§î #dataprotection #privacy #capitalism"

this post critically examines the topic of data privacy and questions the extent to which personal information can truly be protected in today's society. the hashtags #datenschutz (data protection) and #privatsph√§re (privacy) highlight the importance of this issue, while #kapitalismus (capitalism) suggests that the exploitation of personal data is a result of the current economic system. the use of german in this post allows me to engage with a specific audience and context, while also addressing a global issue that affects people all over the world.
